breweries.name: Quaff On! Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Quaff: To drink heartily and with gusto!

At Quaff ON! Brewing Company, 'Gusto' is part of everything we do. Our hand-crafted beers reflect our passion for the brewer's art and our commitment to creating beers that excite and delight the quaffer's palette.
Quaff ON! Brewing Company was formed in 2012 in response to the demand for the iconic craft beers we developed at Big Woods Brewing Company, our brewpub located in the heart of Brown County Indiana. Why 'Quaff ON!'? Because from the day Big Woods threw open its doors in 2009, Quaff ON! has been the rallying cry, the toast, and the salutation of our loyal fans.
When Big Woods founders Jeff McCabe, Tim O'Bryan and Ed Ryan decided to create Quaff ON! Brewing Company, they had one Master Brewer in mind to take Busted Knuckle Ale, Hare Trigger IPA, Six Foot Blonde and Timid Virgin Pale to new heights and a larger market. That Brewer is Mark Havens, whose reputation as a talented and committed 'creator of craft beers' is well known. Mark came on board in time to lend a hand in the conversion of our 60 year old bowling alley into the Quaff ON! brewing facility.
Once Mark got the new brewery up and running and our original Big Woods recipes were in production, Mark began introducing new beers, including Yellow Dwarf Wheat, a hopped up wheat that begs to be quaffed and Sadie the Goat Brown Ale, a hearty homage to the substantial beers quaffed by river pirates 2 centuries ago.
Currently Quaff ON!'s beers are distributed all over Indiana. Look for us at your favorite watering hole and in the craft beer section at package stores throughout the state. If Quaff ON! is not served at your favorite place, send us a note and we'll get it in there! If you're travelling our way, stop in and see us in Brown County and visit us in Nashville at Big Woods Village where you can enjoy fine craft beer, great food and the best in local entertainment.

"Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." - William Shakespeare

data.name: Coopers Best Extra Stout
data.description:
Now here's a beer with punch! 

Coopers Best Extra Stout is a beacon for lovers of a hearty brew. With its robust flavour it is everything a stout should be. 

Brewed naturally using a top fermentation method, Coopers Stout's unique rich, dark texture comes from specially roasted black malt. 

Coopers Best Extra Stout contains no additives and no preservatives.

breweries.name: Coopers Brewery
breweries.description: Coopers Brewery produce a range of Ales,Stouts and Lagers.   Our ale range is brewed by a method of top fermentation, originating in the Middle Ages.  Coopers uses only natural ingredients including malt, hops, sugar, water and a special yeast strain that's over 90 years old.  Coopers do not use preservatives or chemicals in their ale range.   Coopers also produce Stout and Lager beers.  The Lager beers are bottom fermented in cooler conditions, matured for a short period and pasteurised.

data.name: Cosmos
data.description: To quote the great Carl Sagan, “We are a way for the Cosmos to know itself.” Personally, I find that winter stargazing is a great way to aid the Cosmos in this self-discovery. To this end, I brewed Cosmos, the beer, in the style of a robust Foreign Export Stout to have as a companion on those cold, clear nights of celestial exploration. With its big, warm body, rich chocolate and caramel flavors, and delicate oatmeal smoothness, Cosmos stands up to the coldest of New England nights. So whether you’re exploring your inner and outer universe high in the White Mountains or marveling at the night sky through your backyard telescope, Cosmos Stout will help keep your body (to say nothing of your mind) rooted here on Earth.

data.name: Courage
data.description: This rich, hearty stout carries roasty, chocolaty, and toffee flavors up through a pitch black pint capped with a mocha head. Just enough cascade late hops start to break through in the finish, only to be overshadowed by another rush of malty, dark, roastiness.  With age, this beer exhibits more chocolate and less roast. A true winter warmer.

breweries.name: Dick's Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Dick Young started brewing as a home brewer in 1984 and sold homebrew supplies at his business, Northwest Sausage & Deli.  When he wasn’t busy handcrafting smoked summer sausage and pepperoni at the deli he was handcrafting small batches of beer.  Dick built from scratch a three barrel brew house (which we still use today as our pilot system) to start designing and creating recipes in the back of the deli. The beer was so popular among Dick’s friends that he soon found himself exceeding the annual production limit for homebrewers.  In 1992 Dick decided to make his hobby a business and started the application and permit process to create Dick’s Brewing Company.  After two years and many batches brewed, and many beers drank, Dick’s Brewing Company became a reality.

Dick quickly realized he would need more space for his growing passion and built a 2,100 square foot building adjacent to the deli.  He started with the three barrel system and would brew once a week yielding 6 kegs.  Initially he focused solely on three beers: Pale, Porter and Dick Danger.  Dick Danger Ale, is still our best selling beer to date.  When asked why he started the brewery Dick always answered, and I quote, “I started brewing beer for one reason, I was thirsty”.   And we are all so grateful he was.

The brewery was located behind the Deli on Prather Road from 1995 to 2008.  Over those 13 years the brewery grew from 200 bbls in sales in one state to over 3000 bbls in 6 states.   New uni tanks and bright tanks were added along with a brand new bottling line to keep up with demand, and Dicks creative passion for brewing also grew, starting with three recipes in 1994 to over twenty different styles in 2009.  Life was good and  Dick’s Beers were flying out the door.
In 2006 Dick set his sights even higher, and he started construction on a new brewing facility. After two long years of work  we moved into the brand new 18000 square foot brewing facility on Galvin Road in Centralia.

Dick wore many hats and he was so many things to so many people.  In 2009 we lost a brewmaster, a friend, a dad, a partner, a son, a teacher, a rebel, an electrician, a plumber, a carpenter, a craftsman, a joker, a complete and unique leader.  He will always be remembered and by doing so his vision and his dream will forever live on in every bottle or keg that gets shipped from the warehouse to someone that is thirsty.

Today, the Dick’s Brew Crew is led by Dick’s daughter, Julie Young.  With the new brewing facility producing 23 different styles and with plenty of room for growth, we feel that the sky is the limit when it comes to Dick’s legacy.  All of us here at Dick’s are proud to continue the dream that our founder started, and we are proud to have you all along for the ride.

breweries.name: Kuhnhenn Brewing
breweries.description:
Founded in 1998, Kuhnhenn Brewing Company began as a homebrew supplies shop in the family's former hardware store while buildout on the brewery was taking place. 

The company has been producing countless award-winning beer, mead, and wine out of their 8-barrel brewery since 2001. In 2012, Kuhnhenn took home the Gold Medal at the World Beer Cup in the IPA category for their flagship offering, DRIPA, or Double Rice IPA.

The brewery  has expanded to capacity over the years, with only limited distribution in Michigan, New York City, and parts of Europe, in addition to taking part in festivals throughout the world. Construction is underway on a production brewery and second taproom in nearby Clinton Township, which will allow the brewery to get closer to meeting demand by increasing capacity more than 1500% overnight. 

Visit the brewery taproom for to-go sales of some of their award-winning products.

we're pretty sure that the beer made was part ectoplasmic mud intended as a 5th dimensional chrysalis for an almost immediate and rude awakening of shrimp-kind. once fed to the prawny bastards they grow strong and stout. they're tenuous ligament connections calcify and grow stronger and they can appear to read people's minds by a simple flexing of their delicious muscles. they're tv antenna antennas probe the air and gently wave in the breeze though the touch them is as touching rough-grit sand and glass paper and leaves tiny shards similar grabbing the white paint of a fire hydrant marker. 

we had no idea. we swear. 

we're just here's to brew beer, not help with the awakening of the earth's 6th cycle of developed beings. that being said -- all hail the prawn people! may their mighty and lesser claws be bound only by their own strength of will. let the buddha shrimp click and clackle their obscene language to the world.

breweries.name: Odd Side Ales
breweries.description: ​Welcome to Odd Side Ales, one of the fastest growing breweries in Michigan. Born in an old piano factory in downtown Grand Haven, Michigan, Odd Side Ales first opened its doors in March 2010. We've grown steadily since that first brew, but have never lost sight of our initial goal: to create a variety of complex beers, each with its own unique flavor. To that end, we strive to craft unusual beers that will make your taste buds dance. Whether you're looking for the perfect IPA or something ... just a little different, we've got the beer for you.

breweries.name: Paradox Beer Company
breweries.description: Modern brewing processes collide, headlong, into ancient beer. Therein lies the Paradox. The creative forces behind Paradox Beer have explored, wholehartedly, all facets of beer, brewing and drinking and have found the Bedrock of Beer. When all else is removed, Beeris Alchemey sprinkled with Paradigm dashed on the hopes of Artistic Grandeur. In our case we took Wayward Beers, unruly at best, and Bound them in the confines of Experienced Oak in the hopes that the sum would be greater than the parts... A lofty goal! One that the human condition aspires to?

breweries.name: Ex Novo Brewing Company
breweries.description: Brewing great beer blends art and science. We exist to blend fine craft beer with positive social change. Ex Novo translates as "from scratch”, and we’ve been hard at work building a 10-barrel non-profit brewery from the ground up. That's right, we said non-profit. Don't get us wrong, we aren't opposed to making money. On the contrary, we want to make as much as we can, so we can give it away. We are committed to donating 100% of our net profits to organizations that are working to affect positive social change both in Portland and around the world.

breweries.name: The Dandy Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Dandy Brewing Company is Calgary’s true Nano-Brewery. We produce inspired ales, with lots of care, in very small batches.

Our custom built, 3BBL brew-house ensures a keen eye to every detail and fosters creativity in both our recipes and beer styles.

Dandy Ales are living beers; naturally conditioned bottles, kegs, and casks. This return to the true ale tradition ensures the living yeast in the unfiltered and unpasteurized beer will continue to work with the premium malt and complex hops from the moment it is pitched in the fermenters, until it passes your lips!

We are pleased to offer a top notch tasting room on site where you can taste any or all of our eight taps, including Dandy favourites and special one-off beers. There are also tours and a small shop to pick up a variety of Dandy merchandise!

We share a passion for not only brewing, but the people, process, experiences, and personal touches that make the real ale experience so special.

data.name: Danish
data.description:
This is the only lager in our seasonal rotation. The dark brown color and foamy head give the impression of a stout, and the incredible richness of the roast doesn’t belie this impression. There is a distinct Noble hop aroma. The malty finish is in keeping with the style. The overall impression is of a dark beer, with the roasted character of a porter.

Expect to see it whenever I feel like dealing with the hassle of brewing it.

breweries.name: Brooklyn Brewery
breweries.description: Since its founding in 1988, The Brooklyn Brewery brews flavorful beers that enrich the life, tradition and culture of the communities it serves. Its award-winning roster of year round, season and specialty products have gained the Brewery notoriety as one of the top craft beer producers in the world. Brooklyn beers are currently distributed in 25 states and 17 countries, and throughout 2011 the brewery underwent an expansion that will double overall capacity by 2013. In addition to facilitating community meetings at its event space, brewery employees serve on not-for-profit boards, including the Prospect Park Alliance, the Open Space Alliance, Transportation Alternatives and the Brooklyn Historical Society. Each year the company supports many charitable and arts organizations including BAM, Brooklyn Museum and MoMA, and partners with food purveyors across the country to produce beer dinners and tasting events. The Brewery is open to the public Monday-Thursday from 5-7pm for reservation-only Small Batch tours, Friday evening for Happy Hour, and Saturdays and Sundays for Tours and Tastings. For more info, visit BrooklynBrewery.com and follow @BrooklynBrewery on Twitter.

breweries.name: Magic Rock Brewing
breweries.description:
Who are Magic Rock?
Nestled in the industrial Pennine town of Huddersfield lies one the UK’s most exciting and modern craft breweries.  Consistently up there on the rating sites, Magic Rock have brought US inspired beers to the heart of Yorkshire’s brewing tradition.
An ambitious brewery, this year has been big for them picking up a Gold for Salty Kiss in the prestigious Beer World Cup.  They also joined a growing number of UK breweries represented at the Mikkeller run Copenhagen Beer Celebration, an invite for any brewery to celebrate receiving.
 
Why we invited Magic Rock…
They are one of the most exciting and consistently superb breweries in the country.  This year’s Un-human Cannonball, a continuation of their Cannonball IPAs, was something to behold.  Last year they sent down their hallucinogenic six-shooter of a festival bar to LCBF 13, head brewer Stuart painted his beard blue and red and they served up an amazing array of beers, including Beer World Cup winner, Salty Kiss.  This year, expect Yorkshire’s finest to craft flavour and fun into some of the best beer you’ll try this summer.

breweries.name: Paradox Beer Company
breweries.description: Modern brewing processes collide, headlong, into ancient beer. Therein lies the Paradox. The creative forces behind Paradox Beer have explored, wholehartedly, all facets of beer, brewing and drinking and have found the Bedrock of Beer. When all else is removed, Beeris Alchemey sprinkled with Paradigm dashed on the hopes of Artistic Grandeur. In our case we took Wayward Beers, unruly at best, and Bound them in the confines of Experienced Oak in the hopes that the sum would be greater than the parts... A lofty goal! One that the human condition aspires to?

breweries.description:
We are a small handcrafted Brewing Company that specialize in unique flavors. We use only the best ingredients, and use organic whenever it is available.

We believe in making a product that is NOT based off of a profit model, but uses the best local organic ingredients (when available).
                             
We also believe it is important to know what is in the beer you drink and that it is made in an environmentally responsible way.  Ass Clown Brewing strives to be  a "green" brewing company that uses alternative energy and finds uses for brewing waste. For example, our warehouse will have recycled items, lights, furniture and equipment. 

Local ingredients will also be a focus for Ass Clown Brewing Company. We grow our own hops.  As our production expands we will be looking for North Carolina hop growing farms, malting farms, spices and fruits.

data.name: Dark Construct

Dark was the inspiration to make this stout. A great divine power flowed through our bodies as we mashed this baby in for the first time. This thick bodied sweet stout is great all year long. This beer is the first one we have created after having opening and logging around 100 brews on our little system. We confess it to be our most mature beer as we have had ample time to refine our process.

2013 Bronze Medal Carolina Championship of Beer

breweries.name: Gizmo Brew Works
breweries.description: Deep in the Umstead Industrial Park, something stirs. Amid the clank of modern machinery, a group of workers busy themselves with one of the world's oldest crafts: brewing. At Gizmo Brew Works, this meeting of contemporary technology and ancient know-how produces a tempting slate of small-batch beers. Inside tanks that hold the equivalent of 1,000 pints each, brewers prep favorites including the smooth and sweet Black Stiletto Stout and the complex Palisade Wasp India Pale Ale with the same care that has earned many of their past beers medals at the Carolina Championship of Beer. They also save room for seasonals, carefully adding a sweet caramel flavor and spicy Noble hops to their altbier. These beers and more make frequent appearances in the brewery's taproom, gracing pint glasses for impromptu toasts or filling up growlers for at-home sips. Never ones to shy away from curious guests, brewers also open up their facility for Saturday tours, walking groups through the beer-making process during 30-minute explorations.

data.name: Dark Earth
data.description: A stout brewed with a virtual cornucopia of malts, among these are three different heavily roasted malts, both oats and rye, a nice trio of caramel malts, all blended with a nice base of pale malt. This roasty beast is balanced out by a nice mixture of Chinook, Galena and Target hops. A special addition of wood fired, donkey milled, local Sorghum in the whirlpool caps off this brew, that weighs in around 6% abv.

breweries.name: Elysian Brewing Company
breweries.description: The Elysian was founded in 1995 by principals Dick Cantwell (President/Head Brewer), Joe Bisacca (CFO/Head of Operations) and David Buhler (Sales & Marketing Director). Our first Seattle location, a 220-seat beer hall and our main brewery, opened in 1996 on Capitol Hill, Seattle’s most populous neighborhood. In 1997 Elysian was chosen to operate a pub and small brewery at Gameworks—a large entertainment complex owned by Universal Studios, Dreamworks & Sega. Elysian left this partnership in 2002 upon expiration of the five-year contract. A short year later Elysian opened TangleTown, an 80-seat neighborhood brewery/bistro. With a 3-bbl pilot brewery, Elysian-TangleTown acted as the brewers' test kitchen, fueling the creative fires and helping cement Elysian's reputation as Seattle’s top brewpub. The most recent addition to the Elysian empire, Elysian Fields, opened in August 2006. Perched next to Seattle’s two sports arenas, Fields seats 400 and packs the house at lunch and on gamedays. It is typical for us to offer over twenty different Elysian beers between the three locations.

breweries.name: Fegley's Brew Works
breweries.description:
At one of the most difficult times in the history of the City of Bethlehem, the Fegley family entered the brewing and restaurant business. The Bethlehem Steel plant had been shutting down slowly for years – a dying industrial giant of a bygone day – and the region was suffering the loss hard. The downtown had also been bled by the malls and box stores that promised savings to the consumer in exchange for genuine local culture and community. Yet on April 15th, 1998, the same day the the historic Hotel Bethlehem declared bankruptcy and closed, the Bethlehem Brew Works optimistically opened its doors to the public at the corner of Main and Broad Streets. The one other restaurant in the neighborhood closed the following week.

Bethlehem Brew Works chose to ignore the public exodus, and instead celebrated the history of ‘Steel’ and paid tribute to the region’s working class culture in it’s decor and menu. The Fegley’s believed a transformation was already well underway, and would grow with the city as it came to life. Over the course of a dozen years, the family became more involved in the community, and worked with the downtown shop owners to strengthen the downtown. One by one, new restaurants began open, and stores began to keep longer hours to accommodate the growing crowds. Historic Bethlehem now is home to a burgeoning restaurant row and retail shops of all kinds.
2002

Most importantly, the restaurant and brewery grew as well. The Steelgaarden lounge was added, and quickly became a Valley hotspot, and a few years later, the lounge exanded again, annexing another two shop spaces for more nightlife and event space. The kitchen also tripled in size with new space, and the brewery added additional tanks to keep up with the demand for the brews.
2005

With an eye still on things to come, the family looked west into Allentown. Opportunity was difficult to see in a city who’s retail heyday had ended some years before with the departure of Hess’s department store. But the optimistic Fegleys became smitten with the history of the “Queen city” – from it’s role in the War of Independence, to the great silk industry that supplied the world’s fashions, and the great retail era the followed. “The All-American City” as it was known, seemed to be frosted over – and the Fegleys believed it was about to thaw.
2007

In June 2007, years in the making, the Allentown Brew Works opened on Hamilton Street, housed inside the historic Harold’s Furniture Building. Proud to be part of another resurging downtown, the 400 seat restaurant is a testament to the vibrant heartbeat that thrives in the city. Offering two and a half levels of dining, plus state-of-the-art banquet facilities in The Hamilton Room, and multiple bars offering different atmospheres, as well as an outdoor casual patio, Der Biergarten and a new seductive lower level lounge, Silk. The 15-barrel brewery in the Allentown location boasts seven fermentation tanks and eight serving tanks – built with capacity to add a bottling line and begin outside sales of Fegley’s Brew Works in earnest.
2008

In 2008, the Philadelphia Phillies AAA team, the Iron Pigs, opened the new Coca-Cola Park stadium, and added Fegley’s Brew Works to its lineup. With that account in place, and a new sales team behind the brewery sales, Fegley’s Brew Works can now be found at almost 200 locations in the region from Harrisburg to central New Jersey, north to Scranton, and south to Philadelphia where it is very popular.
2010

One of the nation’s leading beer writers and co-founder of Philly Beer Week, Don Russell (aka Joe Sixpack), named Hop’Solutely the Beer of the Year.

Becoming supportive and active in the Allentown community, during their first few years the Brew Works saw eateries come and go. In 2010, the tide seemed to change with major restaurants adding to the draw of the city. For some time, the Fegleys had been constantly thinking up good ideas that they would love to see happen in the neighborhood, when it finally struck them that they should just do it themselves. In an effort to continue to move the Fegley brand toward healthy, sustainable “green” practices, they chose concepts that would fit that ideal.
2011 to Present

In 2011, Fegley’s brewery continues to be recognized as their Arctic Alchemy wins it’s first bronze medal at the Great American Beer Festival and Blueberry Belch wins “Best Summer Beer” at the Philadelphia Summer Ale Festival at the Philadelphia Zoo . Arctic Alchemy goes on to win a gold medal at GABF in 2014 and the pubs continue to win Reader’s Choice Awards and Best of the Valley Awards. View our complete awards list.

With the addition of a bottling line, and the growing success of outside accounts the brewery is closing in on it’s capacity, and soon Fegley’s will begin to nose their way to new opportunities. Perhaps there’s another fragrant wallflower ready to dance.

breweries.description:
Saugatuck Brewing Co. is a traditional Irish style pub that features 15 house-made drafts, hard cider and wines. All beer is produced on site in our 13,000 square foot Brew House. The full menu includes light snacks and unique entrees, along with home made desserts.  We offer 6 mainstay styles in bottles along with 3 seasonals and many specialties.

We feature the only brew-on-site facility in West Michigan. With five copper kettles, an array of natural ingredients, and over 100 recipes, we invite you and your friends to be the Brewmaster for a day. Create your own unique ale and return in two weeks to bottle 60 - 22 oz. bottles of fresh beer with a custom label of your choice.

The Singapore Room is our multi-purpose banquet facility. This includes a 4 tap bar, wine service and customizable menus. The Singapore Room can be rented out for a variety of events including birthdays, graduations, weddings, rehearsal dinners, etc.

data.name: Darkly Chocolate Stout
data.description: Chocolate Stout brewed with English Ale yeast. Dark in color with nice tan head. Roasty aroma with a hint chocolate sweetness and yeast esters. Dark chocolate throughout, subtle and pleasant malty/cocoa finish.

style.name: American-Style Stout
style.description: Initial low to medium malt sweetness with a degree of caramel, chocolate and/or roasted coffee flavor with a distinctive dryroasted bitterness in the finish. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas are prominent. Some slight roasted malt acidity is permissible and a medium- to full-bodied mouthfeel is appropriate. Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.

breweries.name: Finback Brewery
breweries.description: Our goal is to make great beer following our passion for richness and complexity from quality ingredients and small batch artisanal brewing. We focus on pushing American styles and brewing flavorful, unique beers to drink. We like it hoppy and complex to roasty and smokey, strong and sippable to session and gulpable. Most importantly we like it happy and enjoyable. Something to drink with friends, in the backyard, at the beach and at the bar. We make beer because we like to drink and we like to smile.

data.name: Dark~N~Lusty Stout
data.description:
IV Stout is a very dark, top fermented beer made from pale malt, roasted unmalted barley and a caramel malt.

The style was first introduced by Guinness as an extra stout version of their porter. The new stout was darker, hoppier and richer than porter, which it gradually overtook in popularity.

breweries.name: Harmony Brewing Company
breweries.description: In 2012 we set out to make small batches of distinct beer for the public without losing the temperamental nature and artisinal approach of home brewing. Today this hand-crafted harmony of basement ethos and meticulously selected ingredients has become as much of the hallmark of our legendary beers as their exclusivity.  There are only two places on Earth where you can experience a Harmony original and that's on the premise of Harmony Eastown or Harmony Hall.

breweries.name: Braxton Brewing Company
breweries.description:
At Braxton, a garage is more than a garage. It’s a place where we build our hopes and dreams, storing them on the wall neat as garden tools. Really, the garage is a hub. A reliable place from which we launch into the world, and enjoy a safe return.

We hang out in our garages. Saturday mornings, afternoons, long into the night. Sometimes hosting neighbors, family and friends, other times in blissful solitude, tinkering on projects, obsessing over a problem or making something great. Think of the garages in your past. You’ll remember your dad fishing a lawnmower or building a table, where he taught you to say “Yes, sir.” You can almost smell the oil and beer.

But more and more the family garage is an incubator, an enterprise zone. It’s part of the beautiful renaissance happening in the middle of this great country. So it was for Evan Rouse. Evan, from Union, Kentucky, was a pretty extraordinary kid. Because while other kids played video games and started garage bands, Evan fell in love with the craft of brewing beer. And he built a home brewery in the family garage. He was just 16 years old, not even of age.

For Evan, brewing beer was more than an idea, it was a revolution. Because from that humble start, Evan’s love for brewing has become his entrepreneurial obsession. He’s building the brewery of his dreams. And his entire family is on board, helping him get it done. (The truth is, it’s a pretty extraordinary family.)

So welcome to Braxton Brewing Company. You’re witnessing a dream coming to life. A place where ideas are born and fermented. It’s a great deal of work, but hell, that’s what makes a dream worth pursuing. This brewery celebrates determination, knowledge, and the humble pride we wave like a battle flag.

data.name: Deadeye Stout
data.description: Dark and opaque, with a big roasty malty nose, a slight hint of coffee and notes of sweet toffee, all swaddled in oaty creaminess, this beer delivers the full-bodied mouth-feel you expect from a stout.

breweries.name: Triton Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Operated by its member-managers, Jon W. Lang and David M. Waldman, Triton Brewing Company is a brewery producing high-quality craft beer for distribution in Indiana. 

Triton Brewing Company is a creative outlet in the form of a traditional, community-based production brewery located in the heartland of Indiana. The shareholders, employees, and libations of Triton Brewing Company embody exemplary strength of character, resolute integrity, and consistent quality in all their forms. We are dedicated to increasing a sense of fun and community through the creation of fine traditionally crafted ale and lager.

Beer and other beverages produced at our Indianapolis facility are available for sale throughout Indiana and Central Illinois. A tasting room at the brewery and a second tap room location provide other marketing opportunities.

Triton Brewing Company is the realization of the dream of Mr. Lang and Mr. Waldman that Indiana be a significant contributor to the world beer culture and can produce local beers that Hoosiers can be proud of and can purchase statewide.
